interface.name: liri_outputmanagement

description.summary: creates an output configuration to be applied later

interface.description: The liri_outputmanagement global object allows clients to create a configuration for one or more outputs to be applied later.

request.name: create_configuration
request.description: Request an output configuration, which can be changed and then applied.

interface.name: liri_outputconfiguration
interface.description:
This is a set of configuration changes for one or more outputs.
Clients call requests on this resource in order to enable, set as primary, change mode, change transform, move and change scaling factor of one or more outputs. Once all attributes are configured, the client asks the compositor to apply all changesets calling the apply request. At this point the compositor signals back whether all changesets applied successfully or failed to apply.

request.name: enable
request.description: Mark the output as enabled or disabled.

arg.name: enable
arg.summary: request to enable or disable this output

request.name: primary

description.summary: set an output as primary or secondary

request.description: Mark the output as primary or secondary. Shell panels and user-interface elements are shown on primary outputs.

arg.name: primary
arg.summary: request set this output as primary or secondary

request.name: mode
request.description: Sets the mode for a given output by its mode size (width and height) and refresh rate.

arg.name: output
arg.summary: output this mode change applies to

request.name: transform
request.description: Sets the transformation for a given output.

arg.name: output
arg.summary: output this transformation change applies to

request.name: position
request.description: Sets the position for this output device in the global space. position describes the top-left border of the output in the global space. The left-most output's top-left border is 0, 0. There may be no gaps between outputs, the outputs have to be positioned stacked horizontally, vertically, or both.

request.name: scale

description.summary: Set the scaling factor for this outputdevice

request.description: Sets the scaling factor for this outputdevice.

arg.name: output
arg.summary: output this mode change applies to

request.name: apply

description.summary: apply the changes to the outputs

request.description: Asks the compositor to apply changes to the outputs on the server side.

event.name: applied
event.description: Fired after the compositor has applied the changes successfully.

event.name: failed
event.description: Fired if the compositor rejects or failed to apply the changes.
